verse.roman:
vaijayantīṁ dadur mālāṁ
śrī-dhāmāmlāna-paṅkajāṁ
rāmāya vāsasī divye
divyāny ābharaṇāni ca

synonyms: vaijayantīm—named Vaijayantī; daduḥ—they gave; mālām—the flower garland; śrī—of the goddess of fortune; dhāma—the abode; amlāna—unfading; paṅkajām—made of lotus flowers; rāmāya—to Lord Balarāma; vāsasī—a pair of (upper and lower) garments; divye—divine; divyāni—divine; ābharaṇāni—jewelry; ca—and.
translation: They gave Lord Balarāma a Vaijayantī garland of unfading lotuses in which resided the goddess of fortune, and they also gave Him a set of divine garments and jewelry.
